I0305-d-05-15-05-PATH.Narrative: On May 15, 2005 at 4:15pm, two Switchmen, were assigned to move seven cars (740-126-660-857-860-163-805) in on Track 6 at Harrison Car Maintece Facility; coupling two cars (692-867).  The two carswere at the east end of Track 6.  The entire consist were to be moved to the west end of Track 6.  The operating switchman was in Car 660 (fifth car), with overhead trolley attached to the car.  The flagging Switchman was in position in Car 692 (leading car).  The operating Switchman states, "…aftermoving approximately 250 feet (4 to 5 car lengths) west, he was instructed by the flagging Switchman via intercom to stop the train.  I made a full service application and the train continued to move, so I dumped it."   The flagging Switchman states, "… the train went into full brake application and rolled into the shop door."  He also pulled the emergency cord.  The train was allegedly travelingat 3mph and came to a stop 3 ½ feet through the shop door.  Car 692 was observed to have a pulled emergency light indication corroborating the flagging Switchman`s statement.  Track conditions were clear of grease and debris.  Inspection of the cars in consist indicated the following:  Car 692, airleak at the brake valve, Car 126, a ruptured feed valve and leaking brake cylinder pipe, and thesecars were dead, 867-740-857-860-805. 2005127-d-05-08-05-ICE.Narrative: INDUSTRY CARS STANDING ON #2 TRACK WERE INADVERTENTLY LEFT OUT TO FOUL BY INDUSTRY.  IC&E CREW, WHILE PERFORMING SWITCHING OPERATIONS, RELEASED 2 CARS INTO INDUSTRY TRACK #1 AND COUPLED TO 1 CAR ALREADY ON THE TRACK.  CARS ON #1 ROLLED OUT AND IMPACTED CAR NDXX 838036 ON INDUSTRY #2 TRACK.  CREW WASDRUG TESTED WITH NEGATIVE RESULTS.  INCIDENT TOOK PLACE ON INDUSTRY TRACK OWNED BY AMERICAN ITALIANPASTA COMPANY.  DISCIPLINE WAS ASSESSED TO EMPLOYEE RESPONSIBLE FOR 15 ACTUAL AND 15 DAYS DEFERREDSUSPENSION.

I051705ID-d-05-17-05-INPR.Narrative: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD WAS DELIVERING A CUT OF 30 CARS TO OUR INBOUND INTERCHANGE TRACK 402.  A BROKEN RAIL CAUSED THE CHTT 61800 TO DERAIL IN THE MIDDLE OF THE TRAIN, OTHER LOADED CARS BEHIND THE CHTT 61800 DID NOT DERAIL.  THE CHTT 61800 WAS PUSHED APPROXIMATELY 20 CAR LENGTHS DOWN THE TRACK CAUSING EXCESSIVE DAMAGE.
